title: AirPods Max Not Charging? Here's Why & How to Fix It

steps.title: Your AirPods Max may not charge due to a faulty charging connection or software bug.
steps.content: Your AirPods Max may not charge due to a faulty charging connection or software bug. Before you try to fix your AirPods, connect them to a charger and let it sit for a few minutes. Locate the status light on the right earphone. This shows the charge status of your headphones. If the light is off, you may have a faulty charging cable, cube, or mat. If the light is on, you may have software issues.

steps.title: Let your AirPods Max charge fully.
steps.content: Let your AirPods Max charge fully. It takes about two hours to fully charge the AirPods Max from completely empty to 100% full. [1] X Research source Keep the AirPods Max in its case to put them in an ultra low power mode as it charges.

steps.title: Try a different charging method.
steps.content: Try a different charging method. If your device isn't charging, you may have a damaged wire or charging cube. Use a new cable or new source of power.

steps.title: Hard reset your AirPods Max.
steps.content: Hard reset your AirPods Max. If it's plugged in and charging, but the battery level isn't increasing, you may need to reset your headphones. Do the following: Press and hold the Digital Crown and noise control button at the same time until the light flashes amber, and then white. This will take about 15 seconds. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Clean the charging port.
steps.content: Clean the charging port. Debris can build up in the AirPods Max's charging port. Use a dry, soft-bristled brush to gently clean the port, and then try charging it again. The charging port is located at the bottom of the right earphone.

steps.title: Update your AirPods Max.
steps.content: Update your AirPods Max. Your headphones automatically update when they're in Bluetooth range of your iPhone, iPad, or Mac that's connected to Wi-Fi. Make sure Bluetooth is enabled on your device. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Check the battery level.
steps.content: Check the battery level. Open the Smart Case next to your iOS device and wait for the pop-up notification. You should see the charge level at the bottom of your screen.

steps.title: Let your AirPods Max rest.
steps.content: Let your AirPods Max rest. If you're using your headphones for an extended period of time or you live in a hot environment, it may need some time to cool down before it works again.

steps.title: Contact Apple Support.
steps.content: Contact Apple Support . If you're still having trouble with your AirPods, contact Apple. This could be a hardware issue, and you may be covered under warranty.
